bibl.title: Africa in Egypt: New Evidence from Qasr Ibrim.
bibl.note: New evidence sheds new light on the early Roman (23-21 BC) and Meroitic occupation. The Romans probably occupied the site for only the two to three years that the historical evidence suggests.

bibl.title: Egypt and Africa. Nubia from Prehistory to Islam

bibl.seg: HORTON Mark, Africa in Egypt: New Evidence from Qasr Ibrim.
W.V. DAVIES (Ed.), Egypt and Africa. Nubia from Prehistory to Islam (London, 1991) pp. 264-277, 6 cartes et plans.
New evidence sheds new light on the early Roman (23-21 BC) and Meroitic occupation. The Romans probably occupied the site for only the two to three years that the historical evidence suggests.
